title.narrative: REGIONAL PROGRAM TO HARMONIZE AND MODERNIZE LIVING CONDITIONS SURVEYS

description.narrative: The development objective of the Regional Program to Harmonize and Modernize Living Conditions Surveys Project for West African Economic and Monetary Union (Waemu) is to support the WAEMU Commission at strengthening the capacity of its member countries to conduct living conditions surveys that meet harmonized, regional standards, and to make the collected micro-data publicly accessible. The project comprises of two components. The first component is capacity building and survey harmonization and modernization through data collection and dissemination. It consists of following three sub-components: (i) capacity building to harmonize and modernize data collection, processing, archiving, and dissemination; (ii) capacity building by implementing two surveys in each country; and (iii) capacity building through resident advisors, technical assistance, and peerto-peer learning. The second component is quality control and coordination. It consists of following four sub-components: (i) assistance to prepare a ruling pertaining to survey harmonization in the WAEMU; (ii) stimulating micro-data analysis; (iii) modernization of quality control; and (iv) coordination.

title.narrative: WAEMU member countries that completed a 2nd living conditions survey according to harmonized, regional standards
WAEMU member countries which completed the collection of harmonized living conditions surveys that made the anonymized micro-data available to the public through the WAEMU website (*)
Adoption by the WAEMU's Council of Minister of a ruling committing all member countries to apply WAEMU living conditions survey standards with respect to methodology, contents and periodicity
Living conditions surveys that have been subject to review by peers and by independent external parties
WAEMU member countries that archive their harmonized living conditions surveys
A statistical abstract with selected official welfare statistics for WAEMU countries and the region are published by the WAEMU Commission
Draft standardized questionnaires, disaggregated by gender are reviewed by data users
Standardized living conditions survey instruments and manuals(**)developed, and jointly adopted by the NSIs of all eight WAEMU member states
